description:
Lichtheimia ornata is a species of fungus that belongs to the phylum Mucoromycota, class Mucoromycetes, and order Mucorales. It is a filamentous, zygomycete fungus, known for its distinctive sporangiophores (reproductive structures) that are ornamented with warts or protuberances, giving the species its specific epithet "ornata."

Lichtheimia ornata is a saprobic fungus, meaning it derives its nutrients from decomposing organic matter. It is commonly found in soil, decaying plant material, and other decomposing organic substrates. The fungus reproduces asexually through the production of sporangiospores within the sporangia (spore-bearing structures) borne on the ornamented sporangiophores.

This species is of interest in the field of mycology, as it contributes to our understanding of the diversity and ecology of the Mucorales, a group of fungi known for their importance in various biotechnological applications and their potential as opportunistic pathogens in immunocompromised individuals.
